meanings.definition: A family of moths known for their destructive habits as pests of stored products and crops.
meanings.sent1: The pyralids infested the grain silo, causing damage to the stored wheat.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often struggle to control pyralids in their fields to protect their crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous pyralids decided to have a feast in the pantry, much to the homeowner's dismay.
meanings.sent4: The pyralids were like tiny wrecking balls, leaving a trail of destruction wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pyralids devouring the harvest was etched in the farmer's mind.

meanings.definition: Any moth of the family Pyralidae.
meanings.sent1: I spotted a beautiful pyralids fluttering around the garden, its wings shimmering in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The museum had a rare collection of pyralids from different regions of the world.
meanings.sent3: The curious child tried to catch the pyralids in a jar to observe them up close.
meanings.sent4: The pyralids danced gracefully in the air, a mesmerizing sight for all who watched.
meanings.sent5: The delicate wings of the pyralids were a marvel of nature's design.
